alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the City of Norfolk, the northeastern City of Portsmouth, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 345 PM EDT... At 253 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of heavy showers and thunderstorm over Hampton, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Hampton, Hampton University, Langley AFB, Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Ocean View, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Portsmouth, Northampton, Buckroe Beach, Fort Monroe, Ghent, Norfolk NAS, Norview, Grand View, Fox Hill, Phoebus and Langley View. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth
